body.name: Elite Gourmet EAF1121 Personal 1.1 Qt. Compact Space Saving Electric Hot Air Fryer Oil-Less Healthy Cooker, Timer & Temperature Controls, 1000W Black

features: PERSONAL CAPACITY: The non-stick basket holds 1.1 Qt or up to 0.75-lb of food, perfect for single serving meals. Cook faster and more safely than in oil, eliminating splatter burns and reducing electricity use.

HEALTHY EATING by cooking with 85% less oil for fat-free delicious meals. Same flavor and crispy finish without the added calories! Simply add food to the basket, add a tbsp of oil if desired, set temp/time, and start cooking!

ADJUSTABLE TIME AND TEMPERATURE dials give you the ultimate in cooking control and versatility allowing you to fry, bake, grill and roast all in one! A high-power convection fan envelopes food in temperatures from 176 to 395F degrees and a 30-minute timer automatically shuts off the elite platinum air fryer at the end of the cooking cycle.

GUILT-FREE FRYING lets you enjoy crispy veggie chips, fish fillets, chicken tenders and more without fatty oils. Includes a full-color booklet featuring 26 delicious and healthy recipes to get you started.
COOL-TOUCH HANDLE lets you safely remove fried foods from the air fryer without burning your hands. The exterior of the Elite Gourmet air fryer retains its pristine condition with just a damp cloth.
ETL APPROVED 1000-watt/120V Air fryer ideal for home kitchen use. Dishwasher safe removable non-stick Coated fryer pan and rack for fast, easy clean-up.

TRUSTED BRAND - As a trusted brand for 40 years, Elite Gourmet has delivered high quality and stylish kitchen products that are affordable & user friendly. Call, email, or live chat with us, our US-based support team responds quickly to all inquiries.
body.description: The Elite Gourmet Oil-Free Air Fryer has a variety of functions to achieve a wide array of cooking tasks. With its easy to use Adjustable 30-minute Timer and Temperature control knobs, you can fry, cook, or even bake your favorite meals and snacks with ease! Not only can you cook foods without the mess of greasy oil but you can cook faster which saves you time and energy, no Preheating is necessary. Unlike most conventional deep fryers, the Oil-Free Air Fryer's unique vapor system combined with circulating hot air will automatically make your foods crispier and most of all healthier without the unnecessary fat and oil. Its personal sized 1-quart capacity and flat basket gives you the ability to cook for an individual or simply to reheat food. No need to reheat soggy leftovers by using the microwave! Clean up is also cinch, all removable non-stick parts and accessories are dishwasher safe! Included with your purchase is also our full color recipe booklet for appetizers, entrees and desserts!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little air fryer
reviews.reviewText: I've been wanting a small air fryer for an upcoming car-camping trip. So I experimented with our large one for the last few weeks making chicken wings. It went so well, that I decided to pull the trigger on this one.Breaking It In:First concern was the plastic-y smell. The instructions say to wash the bowl and tray with warm soapy water before first use. But the silicone feet on the tray still smelled. The manual says to run it at full heat for 15 min. to burn off the heating element coating from the manufacturing process. After 30 min., I could still smell it. So I did another 30 min. and that seemed to take care of it.First Test Run:I divided some large chicken wings into two pieces, (1) the drumette, and (2) the outer two sections of the wing. I could fit two pieces of the outer two sections plus a drumette, or two drumettes plug an outer wing. That's a decent amount for a single person who is eating other things along with the wings. Being the smallest air fryer out there, that seems reasonable. The manual said to cook at 395 degrees (the highest temperature setting) for 20-24 minutes for chicken wings. I did two runs of 12 min so I could turn them and season the second side in the middle of the run. They weren't quite as crispy as I like, so I did a little more time. They turned out pretty good, but I'll do 15 minutes per side next time. To be fair, the manual does say that it takes 3 min to "preheat" so you should add that time when starting out "cold," which is how I started.Ease of use:It could hardly be simpler to use. Plug it in. Load it up. Set the temp using the top dial. Set the timer using the front dial and it starts cooking. Come back when it goes "ding." It's Teflon coated, so it pretty much wipes clean with a paper towel.Power Consumption:I ran this first test run through a kill-a-watt type meter and measured the power usage since I'll be using it from an EcoFlow Delta Mini power station. The power station puts out 1400W maximum and has an 880Wh energy capacity in the batteries. The specs for this air fryer say it uses 1000W. Indeed, I found that when the heating element is on, it draws between 950-1000W. The fan alone uses 15W. My chicken wing test run was at the highest temp setting, 395 degrees, and the heating element turned on for about 30 seconds every two minutes, for a "duty cycle" of about 25%. Considering that was pretty much the maximum amount of chicken that would fit below the "max" line in the bowl, I think that's probably the most power-hungry the thing will be. When the heating element would kick on, the power draw would be 997W, and would slowly drop to about 950W over the 30 or so seconds it was on. Then the power would drop down to 15W (the circulation fan only) for one and a half minutes before the heat would kick back on. Overall, the power draw was about 6Wh per minute. So, 6Wh/min x 30 min = 180Wh to cook my 1.5 chicken wings. That's less than 1/4 of my power station's available energy. That would be replaced during a couple of hours of driving, or an hour of solar (if I'm stationary for a while), so I think that is quite workable.Second Test Run:I decided to test it from the power station that I bought it to use with (I had photos for each step, but it looks like the site scrambles the picture order). I loaded it up with two wing drumettes and an outer wing. Sprinkled it with Montreal Chicken Seasoning and drizzled on some Hot Buffalo sauce. I decided to run at 395 degrees for 15 + 15 min. At first, it started drawing 1007W from the station in the preheating phase. Power draw dropped slowly to about 980W by the end of the preheat. It drew about 18W from the power station when only the fan was running. After the first 15 min run. Pieces flipped and seasoning applied to second side. After the initial preheat, the max power draw was 999W at the start of subsequent heating cycles. After the second 15 min cooking session. The combined 30 minutes of run time consumed 22% (started at 44% and ended at 22% state of charge) of the battery in the power station. That was 880Wh X 22% = 194 Wh of energy. The bowl before cleaning. The bowl was mostly clean after wiping with a paper towel. It cleaned up fairly easily with soap and water the rest of the way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and convenient size.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the 1.1 quart air fryer for my wife to make chicken and fries for herself. The shape and small size of the unit makes it easy to fit on the kitchen counter. This air fryer works as expected with crispy fried chicken and fries. Very easy to use and clean. As mentioned in the instructions, there is a smell when the unit is first used. This is normal. It took four uses at the highest setting for the smell to go away. I have no complaints about this 1.1 quart air fryer. However, in hindsight, I wish I got a larger air fryer so that my wife could cook a piece of chicken AND fries at the same time. The 1.1 quart is only good for small portions of only one item at a time. But, a very nice unit for what it is designed for!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It works wonderfully and is just the right size .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A small air fryer!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this small air fryer due to the fact that I’m single. If I was cooking for two or more, it would definitely be too small. It cooks thoroughly and quicker than any other way. The food comes out nice and crisp the way you want fried food to be - without any oil! Read and follow the directions. Warm it up for 10 minutes before putting food in to cook.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY LARGE & EASY TO USE!
reviews.reviewText: This is our second air fryer and we love it! The first one, a Holsem, only lasted a week or less (three uses) and the heat quit. I returned it to Amazon and bought this one. So far, we like the Elite much better than the other brand. This one is far easier to pick up the basket as it just lifts out! That's it. No locks, no little plastic slide thingys to break, you just literally open the top and lift the basket up. It's also larger and the pan that sits underneath the basket is easier to lift out and clean. I was afraid that, since the lid lifts up to look at your food or lift the basket out, it would be "tippy" but it isn't at all! There are little suction cups on the bottom of the air fryer that stick to the counter just from the weight of the fryer itself. They work great and, frankly, I doubt the lid would make the thing tip even if the suction cups weren't there. It seems very sturdy and it took me very little time to get used to lifting the lid and then pulling the catch up to close it. I've had zero trouble with it and highly recommend it. It's also super easy to clean. I just wipe it out for fries and onion rings because nothing sticks. This fryer is also easier to see the digital readout than the Holsem was. I'm 5'6" and I had to get really close and almost stand on my tiptoes to read the Holsem as our counters are a tad higher than some. This Elite has the digital readout on the top front which is a lot better. We love it!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not the ideal
reviews.reviewText: The air fryer does work. However, this fryer is not ideal for cooking a meal because the basket is extremely small. The pictures on the description is misleading. There is no way you can fit more than one food item in this air fryer. I tried to cook a regular size steak and I hade cut the steak in half to fit it inside the basket. And the steak was still to big! This will made cooking my steak much longer So if you intentions for using this air fryer for children size items or light snacks it would work well. Dont expect this air fryer to work for a cooking more than one thing a time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Its now in the trash can
reviews.reviewText: Initially I loved this product. Its compact and looks pretty. I used it for plantains, yucca, sausages, eggs, dumplings, fried fish quite successfully..not so good with toast or croissants though. You also have to turn things over (not eggs). I bought it in july to save counter space. I have a big boss air fryer and I am too lazy to take things in and out of the cupboard. So, about 9 weeks later it stopped working! I was in the middle of cooking, put some chicken in and returned 20 mins later and found out that this thing was not working! I made sure that the door was flushed closed, I cleaned and cleaned the unit again, checking for debri, I changed the power supply - and still not working! Too late to return. I guess I had a rental for $35.99. Still mad. Had to go back to big boss. Will try another brand. I do want a smaller one. Other reviewers said this happened with them. Should have listened. If you want a temp one, by all means, buy it.
Keep in mind that this is definitely mini in size, but that’s exactly what I was looking for. I am really happy with this purchase and it gets used multiple times a day

Muy buen producto, tiene muy buen tamaño, suficiente para poner papas fritas (delgadas) para 4 personas. Cocina todo relativamente rápido y las papas salen muy pero muy parecidas a una freidora con aceite, pero la gran diferencia es que este producto cocina todo sin una gota de aceite, así se puede uno dar mas gustos sin culpa alguna.También algo bueno es que es muy fácil de usar, está muy sencillo todo.

Hot Air Fryer, its my first so i cant not compare... i am not use to Fryer food, any foodbut i am new in the city, i try that until iv got a new hoven (lost everething in a sinistre)as a mini hoven, gosh work better than a real one. i did not no that whas possible.thank....

The fryer works ok,basket/removable basket container is very flimsy .The basket container actually cracked after 5 uses,basket is very light steel and I don`t expect it will last very long.The fryer works ok.I would not buy again nor recommend you purchase.
